resources.string: This window (activity) is responsible for processing the payment of a new song and/or album using Android Pay API as described below, along with the ability to transition between songs list, now playing and artists list activities at the top.

This window (activity) is responsible for playing the chosen song with the ability to play, stop, pause, backward and forward, along with the ability to transition between songs list, payment and artist list activities at the top.

Android Pay API can be used, by integrating it in the app. The API is part of Google Play Services (GPS), so GPS have to be implemented first. 

The steps are: 
1. assign a showProgressDialog() and check if user is ready to pay. 
2. Request a payment token, then a gateway token. 
3. Request a network token. 
4. Create a Masked Wallet request 
5. Add a purchase button with WalletFragment. 
6. Create the WalletFragment. 
7. Request the Full Wallet. 
 In addition, there is a tutorial for handling errors and issues relating to payment. 

Source: goo.gl/yCL1bW

A MediaPlayer is a class used to allow the app to have the support for the media files, and the ability to play them, also an AudioManager can be used to better manage the audio files. Additionally, to better design the app to minimize the use of many activities, is to have fragments in one activity. In this app, we can combine songs list and artists list, as two fragments, in one activity with two tabs at the top to navigate between them.
